document.masterDocTitle: Redescription of three species of Apobaetis Day, 1955 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Redescription of three species of Apobaetis Day, 1955 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Universidade Federal de Rondônia-UNIR, Programa de Pós-Graduação em Ciências Ambientais, Programa de Pós-Graduação em Ensino de Ciências, Laboratório de Biodiversidade e Conservação, CEP: 76940 - 000, Rolim de Moura, Rondônia, Brazil. & Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amazônia-INPA, Coordenação de Pesquisas em Biodiversidade, Laboratório de Citotaxonomia e Insetos Aquáticos, CEP 69067 - 375, Manaus, Amazonas, Brazil

heading.emphasis:
Key to the identification of the larvae of the
Apobaetis
species described to date

paragraph.keyLead: 1. Third segment of labial palp completely triangular (Figs 12, 25 and 37 in Nieto 2006 ), with only one apical corner; distal margin of labrum near midline without blunt setae ( Figs 6B , 19 and 31 in Nieto 2006 )..................................... 2

1’. Third segment of labial palp subtriangular or subquadrangular, with two lateral corners ( Figs 2F , 4F and 6F ); distal margin of labrum near midline with blunt setae ( Figs 2A , 4A and 6A ).................................................... 5

2. Segment II of labial palp with strongly rounded distomedial projection (
Fig. 5
in McCafferty 2000 ); segment II of maxillary palp robust and thick (
Fig. 4
in McCafferty 2000 )........................................
A. lakota
[North America]

2’. Segment II of labial palp without strongly rounded distomedial projection ( Figs 2F , 4F and 6F ); segment II of maxillary palp robust and thin ( Figs 2E , 4E and 6E )...................................................................... 3

3. Maxillary palp long, at least 1.5× length of galea-lacinia (Fig. 35 in Nieto 2006 ); dorsal margin of femora with blunt setae (Fig. 38 in Nieto 2006 )......................................................................
A. niger Nieto 2006

3’. Maxillary palp shorter, subequal to galea-lacinia (Fig. 23 in Nieto 2006 ); dorsal margin of femora without blunt setae (Fig. 26 in Nieto 2006 )........................................................................................ 4

4. Labrum with pronounced medial emargination ( Fig. 6a in Nieto 2006 ); segment II of labial palp with distomedial projection, rounded apically (Fig. 12 in Nieto 2006 ).................................................
A. insolitus Nieto 2006

4’. Labrum with shallow medial emargination (Fig. 19 in Nieto 2006 ); segment II of labial palp with distomedial projection pointed apically (Fig. 25 in Nieto 2006 )................................................
A. kallawaya Nieto 2006
5. Tarsal claws longer than tarsi (Figs 10A and 22 in Cruz & De-Souza 2014 ).........................................6
6. Segment III of labial palp subquadrangular ( Figs 2F , 4F and 6F ); abdominal tergum V with lateral mark................ 7

6’. Segment III of labial palp subtriangular (Fig. 16 in
Cruz et al. 2011
); abdominal tergum V with medial mark................................................................................
A. hamadae Cruz, Boldrini & Salles 2011

7. Segment II of maxillary palp without constriction (
Fig. 7
in Cruz & De-Souza 2014 ); segment II of labial palp with straight distomedial projection (Fig. 9 in Cruz & De-Souza 2014 ); paraproct with four marginal spines (Fig. 12 in Cruz & De-Souza 2014 )...................................................................
A. kethepiali Cruz & De-Souza 2014

7’. Segment II of maxillary palp with constriction (Fig. 19 in Cruz & De-Souza 2014 ); segment II of labial palp with pointed distomedial projection (Fig. 21 in Cruz & De-Souza 2014 ); paraproct with one pointed marginal spine (Fig. 24 in Cruz & De-Souza 2014 )........................................................................................
A. pucupi
8. Segment II of maxillary palp without apical constriction ( Figs 4F and 6E )........................................ 9

8’. Segment II of maxillary palp with apical constriction ( Fig. 2E )............................
A. etowah
[North America]
